sentences.sContent: It was a reasonable explanation, but his voice lacked conviction .
sentences.sCn: 这解释合情合理，只是他的语气不坚定。

sentences.sContent: It took her so much effort to speak that what she said carried great conviction (= showed she felt sure of what she said ) .
sentences.sCn: 她费了很大的劲在说，因此说出来的话显得很确定。

remMethod.val: 来自convince (v. 使确信， 使信服)

trans.tranOther: the feeling of being sure about something and having no doubts
